sen.j: 冷泉 為秀（れいぜい ためひで、生年不詳 - 応安5年/文中元年6月11日 (旧暦)（1372年7月12日））は鎌倉時代後期から室町時代前期にかけての歌人。
sen.e: Tamehide REIZEI (?? - July 12, 1372) was a poet who lived from the late Kamakura period to the early Muromachi period.
Tamehide REIZEI (?? - July 12, 1372) was a poet who lived from the late Kamakura period to the early Muromachi period.
Tamehide REIZEI (year of birth unknown - July 20, 1372) was a poet who lived from the late Kamakura period to the early Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: (?? - July 12, 1372) を(year of birth unknown - July 20, 1372) に修正しました。※ 12日はユリウス暦でした。

sen.j: 公卿であったが鎌倉に在住することが長かった。
sen.e: Although he was Kugyo (the top court official), he lived in Kamakura for a long time.
Although he was Kugyo (top court official), he lived in Kamakura for a long time.
Although he was a kugyo (high court noble), he lived in Kamakura for a long time.
sen.cmt: Kugyo (top court official) をa kugyo (high court noble) に修正しました。

sen.j: 冷泉為相の子で、冷泉為成は兄弟。
sen.e: He was a son of Tamesuke REIZEI and was a sibling of Tamenari REIZEI.
He was a son of Tamesuke REIZEI and was a sibling of Tamenari REIZEI.
He was a son of Tamesuke REIZEI and was a sibling of Tamenari REIZEI.

sen.j: 子に冷泉為邦、冷泉為尹がいる（為尹は為邦の子で為秀の養子になったとする説もある）。
sen.e: His children were Tamekuni REIZEI and Tamemasa REIZEI (there has been a theory that Tamemasa was Tamekuni's son but adopted by Tamehide).
His children were Tamekuni REIZEI and Tamemasa REIZEI (there has been a theory that Tamemasa was Tamekuni's son but adopted by Tamehide).
His children were Tamekuni REIZEI and Tamemasa REIZEI (there has been a theory that Tamemasa was Tamekuni's son but adopted by Tamehide).
His official position was Junii (Junior Second Rank) Chunagon (middle councilor).
His official position was Junii (Junior Second Rank) Chunagon (middle councilor).
His official position was Junii (Junior Second Rank) Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: (middle councilor) を (vice-councilor of state) に修正しました。

sen.e: His homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) was Shutaku and his pen name was Matsumine.
sen.cmt: 秀宅→読み方不明、松峯→読み方不明
sen.e: His homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) was Shutaku and his pen name was Matsumine.
His homyo (Buddhist name) was Shutaku and his pen name was Matsumine.
